Terraformtutorial.descriptionItem: This project is a terraform practice where we manage the infrastructure on AWS, defining load balancers and EC2 instances.

Imagen1.descriptionItem: Using app.diagrams, we model the entire diagram of our infrastructure.

Imagen2.descriptionItem: Work dashboard of the instances created with Terraform.

Cicdtutorial.descriptionItem: This project is a CI/CD practice where we dockerize our entire development environment, automate testing, and manage deployment on a Google Kubernetes cluster.

Imagen1.titleItem: GitHub Actions and Google Kubernetes Engine
Imagen1.descriptionItem: To automate the application's deployment, GitHub Actions was used, and Google Kubernetes Engine was used for hosting.

Imagen2.descriptionItem: You can find the code for this project in my GitHub repository and see the CI/CD pipeline in action.

TaskManagerTutorial.descriptionItem: In this video, I show the process to create a user, which requires a confirmation code to log in to the application. Additionally, I demonstrate the drag-and-drop functions within the app.

Imagen1.titleItem: AWS Services Used in the Project
Imagen1.descriptionItem: The application is built on AWS, using an EC2 service to host the backend, COGNITO for user and session management, RDS for database hosting, and AMPLIFY for frontend hosting.

Imagen2.descriptionItem: In this image, we can see the real-time logs of our backend.

RestaurantTutorial.descriptionItem: In this video, I show how using a QR reader with a scale, the system could identify the product and, based on the weight, calculate it for inventory control.

Video2.descriptionItem: In this video, I show a test of the order module. When a table placed an order, a ticket, known as a 'comanda,' was sent to the chef in the kitchen.

Imagen2.descriptionItem: For confidentiality reasons, this code cannot be shared, but the system was built using C# and PostgreSQL for the database.

UberCloneTutorial.descriptionItem: In this video, I show the process of creating an account, logging in, and using the app to request a ride.

Imagen1.descriptionItem: This app uses the Clerk service for user and session management.

Imagen2.descriptionItem: For data hosting, a cloud database service called NeonDB is used.
